As an AI language model, I don't have opinions, but I can provide information regarding the accountability of suppliers for sustainability standards.

You are correct that companies must hold their suppliers accountable for sustainability standards to ensure that sustainability remains a top priority. Companies can take steps to hold suppliers accountable by:

1. Setting Clear Expectations - Companies should clearly communicate their sustainability standards and expectations to their suppliers.

2. Conducting Audits and Assessments - Companies can conduct periodic audits and assessments of their suppliers' sustainability performance to ensure that they are meeting the standards set by the company.

3. Implementing Policies - Companies can create policies and procedures that outline the consequences of non-compliance with sustainability standards.

4. Offering Support and Incentives - Companies can provide training and resources to help suppliers meet sustainability standards, as well as offering incentives for compliance and penalties for non-compliance.

If a supplier consistently fails to meet sustainability standards, companies may need to consider terminating the contract. While this may be difficult, it is essential to maintain integrity and ensure that companies are not supporting unsustainable practices.

Overall, accountability is an essential component of supply chain sustainability, and holding suppliers accountable is necessary to ensure that sustainability remains a top priority.
